responses.rationale: The segment states a current impact ('impacts food prices') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current impact ('impacts food prices') and provides context but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past action ('have suspended certain food items') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past action ('have suspended egg-related items') and provides context but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes an ongoing situation ('ongoing bird flu outbreak globally that's affecting') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual detection ('has detected a highly pathogenic bird flu virus') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a past event ('outbreak followed several outbreaks') and current trend ('virus is spreading quickly again') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a potential consequence ('Outbreaks can prompt importing countries... to impose trade restrictions') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a current concern ('raising concern') and a capability ('virus can be transmitted to humans') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('often spread by migrating wild birds') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment compares current and past numbers ('4.6 million birds killed this year compares to the nearly 58 million birds... slaughtered last year') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment notes a past decline ('that decline is welcome news') but focuses on ongoing risk ('infections continue is a worrisome indication', 'likely always be at risk'), not future relief speculation.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('spread easily') and its capability ('mutates over time') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a predictable current trend ('cases of bird flu have predictably begun popping up') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('had to be slaughtered last week') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('prices also spiked over the past two years') and contributing factors but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports confirmed cases and speculates about a future negative impact ('could see Americans paying more') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment reports confirmed cases ('cases have been confirmed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('spreads easily') and its potential outcome ('can prove deadly') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('Several outbreaks have also occurred') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past outcomes ('resulted in the U.S. poultry industry having to kill') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports an expectation of future negative impact ('expects food prices... to surge') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment contains explicit calming cues ('risk of humans contracting the virus still remains low', 'no cases... have been detected'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment describes a past fear about a potential future negative event ('might be on the verge of triggering a devastating pandemic') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('infected 18 people, killing six of them. That happened in 1997') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment describes a past event ('triggering the latest round of fears') and speculation about a future negative event ('might be inching closer to acquiring the ability to easily transmit') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current assessment ('The mink outbreak is concerning') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual relationship ('Minks are closely related to ferrets') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('it's important to remember that we've been somewhere like this before'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment states current facts ('H5N1 has a much larger geographic footprint now', 'been found to infect many more species') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment mentions a past event ('it quieted down for a while') and current uncertainty about the future path ('hedging their bets about the path H5 may be on') but not speculation about relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('were the first to report') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment expresses uncertainty about the future ('I just don't know what it's going to do') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a biographical fact ('He retired from Hong Kong University') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an opinion about plausibility ('I think both of those discussions are plausible') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement of the situation.

The segment describes the focus of questions ('how they assess the current situation and how they'd describe their individual level of concern') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past/present state of mind ('None of them ever stopped worrying') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a present state of mind ('None of them like what they're seeing now') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a present state of mind ('None of them like what they're seeing now') and difficulty answering but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('raised the specter of limited person-to-person spread') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Egypt recorded more than 250 human cases') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a cumulative fact ('about 870 confirmed human cases have been detected') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a cumulative fact ('Just over half of those people died') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current worry ('what worries me right now') and observation ('seeing more chances') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('In '97 there was a pandemic threat') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('had to fight to publish their studies') and past concern but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an opinion/assessment ('does not view the mink farm outbreak... as H5N1's third act') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('occurred in October, saw H5N1 viruses move about... sickening and killing') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a past/potential event ('seems possible, perhaps even probable, that at some point H5N1 spread') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current reaction ('gives flu researchers pause') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual count ('reports 110 reports of mammalian infections') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current difficulty ('It's hard... to assess the significance') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a historical capability ('virus has long had the capacity to infect mammals') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('died in late 2003 after being fed poultry infected with H5') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past detections ('Over the years infections... have been detected') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past experience ('We have been there') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a current uncertainty ('one cannot say with certainty whether there was ongoing transmission or if the infected animals all had a common exposure') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Dead and sick birds infected with H5N1 were reported... leading up to the outbreak') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current assessment ('there's just a whole lot more of it out there') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment compares past frequency ('wasn't uncommon to have 20 or 30 cases a year') with current frequency/severity ('reports of human cases are rare these days, and often involve such mild disease') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('A man in Colorado who was culling infected poultry last spring') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Two poultry workers in Spain in November') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('A British man who had infected ducks in 2021') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a recent event ('A recent H5 infection in a young girl reported from Ecuador is a rare severe case') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment explains a past decline ('decline in human cases is due to genetic changes... that took place a while back') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past fact ('For years, the internal genes of H5N1 were unchanging') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual origin ('Their origin was another bird flu virus, H9N2') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a past fact ('human infections... were caused by viruses that had that combination') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a past event ('acquired other internal genes through reassortment') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current worry ('Fouchier worries primarily at the moment') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('There will be a new pandemic for sure') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('There will be a new pandemic for sure') and expresses uncertainty but not speculation about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an agreement ('None of the scientists quoted here would disagree') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current assessment ('I think it's a major problem') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states facts about other viruses ('many other avian influenza A viruses circulating') and past outcomes ('have sporadically transmitted... and have caused a wide range of illness') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a general truth ('wherever you go... you will find swine influenza viruses') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current worry ('He worries that the Covid-19 experience... has eroded political support') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current worry ('Osterholm worries about what the Covid pandemic has done to public support') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative scenario ('it would be very difficult to get the public to do anything') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current realization ('What has become clear to me... is that the big challenge is not the viruses') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a current challenge ('The real challenge is whether people... have the ability') and expresses a lack of encouragement/worry ('I don't see so much which encourages me', 'what gives me a pit in my stomach') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current status ('The regulatory status... is unclear') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('reported lobbying the executive branch this summer') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('dispatched its lobbyist... to engage') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current activity ('are also lobbying on the outbreak') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment lists groups ('includes the Idaho Dairymen's Association') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment lists lobbying priorities (potential future actions/policies) but does not speculate about future relief or improvement of the outbreak situation itself.
The segment reports past lobbying on future prevention/resources but does not speculate about future relief or improvement of the outbreak situation itself.
The segment reports a past event ('understood to have suffered multiple outbreaks over the past week') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative impact ('Shoppers could face shortages') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current status ('The situation is particularly acute') and reports past events ('after 14 outbreaks in the past month') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('has been hit particularly hard... after five outbreaks... in the past week') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states current fears about a future negative impact ('fears the availability... will be severely affected') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment suggests a future action ('retailers are likely to have to look at imports') to mitigate a problem, but not speculation about relief or improvement of the situation itself.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('probably carried by migrating birds, spreading through direct contact') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('can also be spread by contaminated feed and water') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past outcomes ('47.7 million birds have been culled since last autumn and many more thousands of wild birds have died') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('More than 100,000 ducks were reportedly culled... earlier this year') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('situation is likely to worsen') but not future relief or improvement.

The segment compares past trends ('cases dropped in the summer') with the current situation ('outbreaks continued', 'now endemic', 'risk of infection all year') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states the purpose of doses ('intended for those most exposed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('risk... is considered to be low'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment reports a factual event ('A fourth farm worker has been infected') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual event ('The worker had direct contact with infected dairy cows') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('Three previous cases... have been reported') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past outcomes ('Two of those workers also developed pink eye, while one had mild respiratory symptoms') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('In 2022, the first U.S. case of bird flu was detected') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('does not change the agency's assessment that the risk to the general public remains low'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment states a factual risk assessment for a specific group ('people with prolonged contact... are at higher risk') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports factual test results ('Tests at the state level were inconclusive, but samples sent to CDC tested positive') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current status ('Full results... are pending') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual count ('more than 135 dairy herds... had reported infections') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual event ('Romania has reported a new outbreak') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports factual outcomes ('killed 6,770 birds and led to the slaughter') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment provides a definition/description ('is an infectious viral illness that spreads primarily among wild and domestic birds') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a capability ('can sometimes jump into animals') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual circumstance ('the latest cases in Colorado were among poultry workers') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual assessment of risk ('It is rare for avian influenza to infect humans') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states factual circumstances ('all those infected were working at a poultry farm... and had direct contact') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states factual symptoms ('symptoms for all four patients have been mild') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('could trigger a pandemic in the future') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment is a question ('Do you have a question about bird flu?') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('often carried by wild birds that can then transmit the virus') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports actions taken ('Animals slaughtered and restrictions introduced') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states current attention ('attracting the attention') and capability ('virus can be transmitted to humans') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports an action taken ('All animals were slaughtered') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual detail ('The serotype in this outbreak was H5N8') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes how the virus spreads ('circulates naturally among wild birds, and when they migrate... can be spread') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a capability and low risk ('can affect humans in rare cases') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual identification ('Tests have identified the H7N3 strain... at a poultry farm') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('came after the H7N3 highly pathogenic strain... was discovered') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a capability/potential negative change ('a low pathogenic avian influenza strain can quickly develop into a highly pathogenic strain') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event/outcome ('A 59-year old man died on April 24 after experiencing fever') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment reports factual circumstances ('had been in bed for three weeks prior to testing positive... and had underlying health conditions') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a current uncertainty ('source of exposure to the virus is unknown') and reports a past event ('H5N2 virus has been reported') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual ongoing situation ('industry has been dealing with a bird flu outbreak since last year') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual event ('The Minnesota farm is the first egg-laying operation where bird flu has been found this year') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment reports recent events ('number of cases reported over the past month') and describes how the virus spreads ('virus can be found on any farm because it is spread easily') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual risk assessment ('Infections in humans are rare and usually come only in people with prolonged exposure') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual event ('Another person... has also tested positive') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states current concern ('have concerned scientists and federal officials') about potential future negative events ('risks to humans from further spread') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual assessment ('There is no known link or contact... suggesting only animal-to-human spread') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual outcome ('only suffered conjunctivitis, or pink eye') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states factual circumstances ('works at a Central Valley dairy facility suffering an outbreak') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports factual symptoms ('experienced mild symptoms, including conjunctivitis') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Cows at dairy farms... began testing positive... in late August') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('The risk to the general public remains low'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment reports a past event ('Missouri last month confirmed bird flu in a person') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current difficulty/uncertainty ('scientists and public health officials... are largely in the dark') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('unusually high influenza A activity began lighting up', 'first cases... were confirmed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past finding ('found the spikes were mostly due to large amounts of viral fragments') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past hypothesis ('team hypothesized that those viral fragments were the result of discharges') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current difficulty ('there's currently no good way to determine the exact source') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual event ('Michigan reports a human case of bird flu') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Their results... were published Monday') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current status ('the dashboard shows only overall influenza A activity') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a future action ('CDC launching wastewater dashboard to track bird flu virus spread') but not relief or improvement of the situation itself.
The segment states a current status/criteria ('the CDC is only including data from wastewater treatment sites') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current need/difficulty ('there is still a lot the field... has to learn') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current need/desire ('particular data that local public health authorities are hungry for right now') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment is a question about the current situation ('is that actually being driven by an H5 virus or not?') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment suggests a future method ('Store-bought milk could be another way to track') but not relief or improvement of the situation itself.
The segment states a current activity ('Wastewater isn't the only workaround that researchers are using to try to track') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('officials have stressed that the risk to the public from H5N1 remains low'), which disqualifies it from Q10.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('that would increase the potential risks to people') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual event ('This is the first time a patient who did not work with any poultry or dairy farms has tested positive') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('patient... was hospitalized on Aug. 22') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('a sample was sent... where it was confirmed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a lack of information ('officials did not provide details') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states factual information about reported cases ('Missouri has not reported any H5 infections... although there have been some cases reported') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a capability/potential future event ('could lead to a genetic reassortment... and creates a new influenza virus') but not relief or improvement.
The segment describes a potential future virus ('A virus that has the transmissibility of seasonal influenza and the severity of H5N1') but not future relief or improvement.

The segment reports a past decision ('the decision came as concerns were raised') and past events ('two farms... reported positive avian flu tests') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a factual confirmation ('The positive cases were confirmed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual event ('pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) has just crossed a new frontier') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states current concern ('raises concerns') and potential future negative implications ('potential implications for human health') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a correlation/potential future negative outcome ('The more it adapts to mammals, the more important it becomes for humans') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current worrying ability ('has shown a worrying ability to adapt to mammalian hosts') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports past events ('virus was detected', 'marine mammals began showing symptoms') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a general capability ('Influenza viruses commonly mutate and exchange gene segments, enabling them to adapt') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current capability ('This virus is capable of adapting to mammals') and provides evidence but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a likely cause of past spread ('likely facilitated the spread of the virus') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a current risk ('Farmworkers face some of the most intense exposures') and potential future negative outcome ('lack resources to fall back on if they became ill') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past outcome ('experienced eye irritation') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment speculates about a future negative event ('could mutate to spread... which could spark a pandemic') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states current behavior ('Farmworkers rarely do that') and likelihood ('unlikely to go to a doctor unless they become very ill') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current belief/concern ('many worker advocates believe the virus has spread to more people') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment describes a potential future negative outcome ('couldn't afford to do either') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current assessment ('starts to sound like a really bad deal') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a potential future negative outcome ('wouldn't necessarily cover hospitalization if it were needed') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.

The segment states a current concern ('workers' bigger concern appears to be') and potential future negative outcomes ('have to stay home... or might even lose their jobs') but not future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current fear ('They may fear attention... will inflame anti-immigrant fervor') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a historical fact ('Societies have a long history of blaming marginalized communities') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('Latino immigrants were verbally attacked during the H1N1... pandemic in 2009') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a current situation ('many workers... have been told very little about this new disease spreading') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment reports a past event ('did not immediately receive requests') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an opinion/need ('protective equipment offerings need to be practical') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an opinion/assessment ('It wouldn't be realistic to expect them to also wear N95 face masks') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states an opinion/suggestion ('Plastic face shields seem like a better option') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
The segment states a factual risk ('also face potential infection') but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
